Description: Bowl of Nile silt pottery with flat base, flaring sides and everted rim, coated with red slip and burnished; interior decorated in creamy-white pigment with chevrons and cross-hatched geometric motifs
Curator's comments: W. M. F. Petrie, Diospolis Parva: the cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. Egypt Exploration Fund Memoir 20. (London 1901), pl. xi.C31b; reproduced as White Cross-line C33N in Petrie’ Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery, pl. xxii.
